pros: Somewhat flexible schedule, ok pay, good coworkers
cons: Company is money hungry but says it's client care

pros: The one good thing about this job is flexibility and assistance with an internship.
cons: The management is extremely poor, and they will make sure you work more hours than intended due to the high caseload, and constant employees leaving.

job_title: Client Relationship Representative (CRR) in Kokomo, IN
pros: I love being a receptionist. I love the relationships I made with our clientele and being the face you see when you enter the building. I tried to always be cheerful when greeting our clients even though what I was dealing with may have been stressful. I made great relationships with colleagues which made the work environment so great. I loved knowing what was expected of me, and clocking in and getting busy. No day was slow as I had so much to do, but I loved doing it.
cons: The management was micromanaging. I felt as if they didn't trust me to do my job, even though I had worked there nearly 5 years by the time I left. Management was constantly changing how things were done, and started expecting us to log everything we did, down to how many phone calls we answered, made, how much paperwork was filed, and so on. Management would say one thing to your face, then you would hear something different from someone else. I witnessed a manager degrade an employee in front of other employees. Very unprofessional. They had a "lead by words, not example" way of doing things.

pros: Insurance was great & loved the flexibility.
cons: It was very stressful .

pros: The clients where the reason I stayed as long as I did
cons: I was fired during the beginning of covid shut down with threats due to being unable to attend client needs in home per the companies restrictions

review_title: Take care of your mental health and do not work for this toxic company.
pros: I truly do not know any
cons:
The culture is extremely toxic
The husband and wife running things provides a very big conflict of interest, as the wife is the CEO and the husband is the CFO. However, he completely runs the show and believes everyone is replaceable.
The company will cut your pay for no valuable reason and give you a bigger work load.
The turnover in the companyis extremely high, and with reason!!
The HR department has seen a complete turnover 3 times withing the last few years
I could go on and on truly, but I would rather not rehash all of the mental stress not that I am in an amazing work environment with a new company.

pros: Flexible, great coworkers, supportive management
cons: Unacceptable expectations for rvus and stressful job

pros: Literally flexibility. That's IT. They do not care about you as a person.
cons: The WORST company I have ever worked for. They could care less about your mental health, for being a mental health company. They pile work on you with no guidance and expect you to remember hundreds of deadlines, while providing client care. Supervisors know NOTHING of the children and their stories or trauma. They are literally no help at all. This company is known for pushing numbers/metrics to get the highest payout and high turnover rate. Skills Trainers get paid $1 more than the receptionist now- since they bumped the pay for everyone but those with college degrees. Do not apply.

pros: Good money, nice co-workers, doctors are very nice. Nice to have the time to talk to patients.
cons: Poor management. Constant staff turnover. They don't care how many hours they work you. Lots of negativity for higher ups.

pros: Getting to work with the clients, co-workers, the schools.
cons: Unsupportive leadership, unrealistic expectations of staff at every level. Had to have phone with me 24/7. Leadership will choose stakeholder relationships over client care every single time.

review_title: Great employees who care about the clients
pros: There are many great employees who care deeply about the clients and work diligently to ensure they receive the best care possible.
cons: I do not have cons to list for this employer.

review_title: Worst upper management I have ever seen.
pros: The peers that I worked with were the best.
cons: Hired in under different management, so I know what was possible. They cut our compensation, took away our holiday pay. last year was first year we can remember we didn't get a bonus. We lost 5 full time nurses and I hear number 6 has quit, they have been able to hire 1 so far to replace them. the turn over is unbelievable and not just nurses. it's across the board.

cons: Micro-management, more involved in the overall appearance of Four County looked and employee's are second to none.

cons: Paperwork given the nature of the work; very slow movement upward
